snippet: A vacant brownstone on East 126th Street is slated for demolition by the city, despite neighbors’ laments about puncturing the continuity of the block.
abstract: Vacant brownstone on East 126th Street in Harlem is slated for demolition by the city despite neighbors’ push for preservation; New York City officials say that building, which does not have landmark designation, was improperly maintained and must be demolished for public safety.
lead_paragraph: A vacant brownstone on East 126th Street is slated for demolition by the city, despite neighbors’ laments about puncturing the continuity of the block.

headline.seo: On Harlem Block, Push for Restoration Will End in a Demolition
headline.main: On Block in Harlem, Neighbors’ Push for Restoration Will End in Demolition
headline.print_headline: On Block in Harlem, Neighbors’ Push for Restoration Will End in Demolition

keywords.value: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)
